image_1.description: A dataset with 11k entries for sentiment analysis of movie reviews, used in SentEval for binary classification tasks.
A dataset with 4k entries for product reviews, used in SentEval for product review classification tasks.
A dataset with 10k entries for subjectivity/objectivity classification, used in SentEval for subjectivity/objectivity classification tasks.
A dataset with 11k entries for opinion polarity analysis, used in SentEval for opinion polarity classification tasks.
A dataset with 6k entries for question-type classification, used in SentEval for question-type classification tasks.

image_3.description: The Movie Reviews dataset used for evaluation, one of the transfer tasks used for evaluating the performance of the sentence encoder.
The Customer Reviews dataset used for evaluation, another transfer task used for evaluating the performance of the sentence encoder.
The Multi-Perspective Question Answering dataset used for evaluation, also known as the opinion polarity task.
The TREC question type classification dataset used for evaluation, an event or task mentioned in the text, likely a question-type challenge.
The Microsoft Research Paraphrase Corpus dataset used for evaluation, a dataset for paraphrase detection mentioned as an event or challenge in the text.
The Sentential Inference Corpus with Explicit Premises dataset used for evaluation, an entailment dataset serving as an event or challenge in the text.

image_4.description: SICK-R is one of the bigger datasets mentioned in the context of SentEval, where more complex models are often required, and it is also an event or dataset labeled as SICK-R, with corresponding performance scores for each model.
